p.s: The question of the speech might have an impact on the audience attending it at COP26 and on the broader public, is in my opinion easy to answer - no.
Due to its emotional character=, for example the six speakers is expressing their opinions, or the naming of the fate of future gernationgenerations, it is very convincing.
But the real question is whether it will have an effect in climate politics.
According to Attenborough we all have to learn to be more sustainable to be classified as a developed nation, we should do this all together with ensuring that no one is left behind.
Which basically means that the global nothNorth should help the global southSouth to become more climate friendly and sustainable.

In this point the speech indeed had an impact on the audience attending it at COP26 because one of the decisions made was the fact, that the global north should support the global south financially, so they can be able to change and become more eco-friendly for example change from the use of coal for engeryenergy to renewable engeriesenergies.
This depicts how to speech at least had a small impact to its listeners.

Another Factor why I believe this speech is impactful is that it is reliable, because Attenborough says that those who've done the least to cause this problem, or being the hardest hit (ll. 18f.) which means that the global South did not play a big part in globalization and did not produce so many emissions in comparison to the global North, but they are still being hit the hardest in climate change.
This is also true because during COP26 it came out that China is responsible for 31% of the global emissions in the US for 15%, which depicts the huge impact of the global North.

On the other hand many people were dissatisfied with the results of COP26, one of them would be the famous climate activist Greta Thunberg who described the outcome of the conference with the words blah, blah, blah.

It is also important to add that the 1.5 degrees goal, which is a by scientist suggested limit, means that the man-made global warming should not get over 1.5 degrees otherwise there will be horrible consequences like natural catastrophe like floods, melting polar ice caps and heatwaves, was not reached.
Not even closely, the conference came to the conclusion that 2.7 degrees as the limit is close enough.
In addition the goal to stop using coal now was not reached, the phrasing on the coal exit was weakened last minute in favor for China and India.
Therefore one important goal was not reached even though it is such an important aspect to stop climate change and minimize global warming.
Which means that the speech did not have that big on an impact on the audience like may it seems in the beginning.
Furthermore I do not believe that the speech has an impact on the broader public, even though it was very appealing to the emotions.
Surveys found out that almost everybody thinks that they are already doing enough for the climate.
They also think that they are doing more thenthan everybody else, especially their own government.

Most people say they would agree stricter laws to preserve our earth and stop climate change but at the same time it is normal for them to fly to a far destination for summer vacation every year or to buy more clothes than they can possibly ever wear.
These factors combined lead me to the conclusion that no matter how emotional appealing and reliable this speech is, it is not impactful enough.
He did not have a big influence on the politicians of the COP26 because the very important 1.5 degrees goal is very far from being reached.
Moreover the broader public is not ready to start changing more things because it is uncomfortable for them and need some afforteffort, which most people are not ready to invest.
